heading: slim, and none
subheading: in a vote that split along party lines, the republican-led senate narrowly passed sweeping spending cuts in an effort to balance the federal budget without cutting social security. the bill, which passed the house of representatives last week, provides for an across-the-board spending cut of about us$4 billion, targeting all programs that congress controls in the annual budget. it now goes to president clinton, who will probably sign it when hell freezes over. in other words, expect a veto.
author: wired staff
text: in a vote that split along party lines, the republican-led senate narrowly passed sweeping spending cuts in an effort to balance the federal budget without cutting social security. the bill, which passed the house of representatives last week, provides for an across-the-board spending cut of about us$4 billion, targeting all programs that congress controls in the annual budget. it now goes to president clinton, who will probably sign it when hell freezes over. in other words, expect a veto.
